executiveSummary.problemStatement: Individuals and small teams struggle to stay organized and productive due to scattered to-do lists, forgotten tasks, and lack of visibility into progress. Current solutions are either too complex with overwhelming features or too simple to provide meaningful organization and tracking capabilities.
executiveSummary.targetUsers: Individual professionals, freelancers, students, and small team members (2-5 people) who need a straightforward way to capture, organize, and track their daily tasks without the complexity of enterprise project management tools. Primary users are tech-savvy individuals aged 25-45 who value simplicity and efficiency.
executiveSummary.valueProposition: TaskFlow provides the perfect balance of simplicity and functionality, offering essential task management features without overwhelming complexity, enabling users to stay organized and productive with minimal learning curve.
executiveSummary.missionStatement: To help individuals and small teams achieve their goals through simple, intuitive task management that eliminates overwhelm and maximizes productivity.

mvpValidationGoals.description: Validate user demand for a simple task tracking solution
mvpValidationGoals.successIndicator: 500+ active users within 30 days of launch

mvpValidationGoals.description: Prove the technical feasibility of core task management features
mvpValidationGoals.successIndicator: System handles 10,000+ tasks with <2 second response times

mvpValidationGoals.description: Validate user engagement with core features
mvpValidationGoals.successIndicator: Users create average of 5+ tasks per day and complete 70%+ of created tasks

explicitNonGoals: Advanced project management features like Gantt charts
acceptanceCriteria: Users can create, edit, and delete tasks
Users can organize tasks with categories and due dates
Users can mark tasks as complete
Users can view tasks in multiple layouts

features.name: Task Creation and Management
features.description: Users can create new tasks with titles, descriptions, due dates, and priority levels. Tasks can be edited, updated, and deleted as needed. This is the foundational feature that allows users to capture and manage their to-do items in a structured way. The interface should be quick and intuitive, allowing rapid task entry without unnecessary friction.
features.userStory: As a user, I want to quickly create and manage tasks with relevant details so that I can capture all my to-dos in one organized place

acceptanceCriteria.given: I am on the main dashboard
acceptanceCriteria.when: I click the 'Add Task' button and enter task details
acceptanceCriteria.then: a new task is created and appears in my task list

acceptanceCriteria.when: I click edit and modify the task details
acceptanceCriteria.then: the task is updated with my changes

acceptanceCriteria.given: I want to remove a task
acceptanceCriteria.then: the task is permanently removed from my list

edgeCases: Creating tasks with empty titles
Setting due dates in the past
Handling special characters in task descriptions
Creating tasks with extremely long titles or descriptions

features.name: Task Status and Completion
features.description: Users can mark tasks as complete, pending, or in-progress with visual indicators for each status. Completed tasks can be viewed separately or hidden from the main view. This feature provides users with a sense of accomplishment and helps them track their progress. The status changes should be immediate and satisfying to encourage continued use.
features.userStory: As a user, I want to mark tasks as complete and track my progress so that I can see my accomplishments and stay motivated

acceptanceCriteria.then: the task is marked as complete with visual feedback

acceptanceCriteria.when: I toggle the completed tasks view
acceptanceCriteria.then: I can see or hide my completed tasks
the completion time is recorded and displayed

edgeCases: Rapidly clicking complete/incomplete toggles
Completing tasks that are overdue
Bulk marking multiple tasks as complete

features.name: Task Categorization and Labels
features.description: Users can organize tasks using custom categories or labels such as 'Work', 'Personal', 'Shopping', etc. Categories can be color-coded for visual organization. Users can filter and view tasks by category, making it easier to focus on specific areas of their life or work. This feature helps users maintain better organization and context switching.
features.userStory: As a user, I want to organize my tasks into categories so that I can focus on specific areas and maintain better organization

acceptanceCriteria.given: I am creating or editing a task
acceptanceCriteria.when: I assign a category to the task
acceptanceCriteria.then: the task displays with the category label and color

acceptanceCriteria.given: I want to focus on specific tasks
acceptanceCriteria.then: only tasks from that category are displayed
I can see all categories with their respective color coding

edgeCases: Creating categories with duplicate names
Assigning multiple categories to one task
Deleting categories that contain tasks
Creating categories with special characters or excessive length

features.name: Due Date Management and Reminders
features.description: Users can set due dates for tasks and receive visual indicators for overdue, due today, and upcoming tasks. The system provides clear visual hierarchy showing which tasks need immediate attention. Due dates help users prioritize their work and manage deadlines effectively. The interface should make it easy to spot urgent tasks at a glance.
features.userStory: As a user, I want to set due dates for my tasks and see which ones are urgent so that I can prioritize my work effectively

acceptanceCriteria.then: the task displays the due date with appropriate visual styling

acceptanceCriteria.given: I have tasks with various due dates
acceptanceCriteria.then: overdue tasks are highlighted in red and due today tasks are highlighted in orange

acceptanceCriteria.given: I want to see urgent tasks
acceptanceCriteria.then: tasks are ordered with most urgent first

edgeCases: Setting due dates far in the future
Setting due dates in the past
Changing due dates on completed tasks
Handling timezone differences for due dates

features.name: Task Search and Filtering
features.description: Users can search for tasks by title, description, or category, and apply filters to view specific subsets of tasks (completed, pending, by category, by due date). This feature becomes essential as users accumulate more tasks over time. The search should be fast and intuitive, helping users quickly locate specific tasks or groups of related tasks.
features.userStory: As a user, I want to search and filter my tasks so that I can quickly find specific tasks or focus on particular groups of work

acceptanceCriteria.when: I type in the search box
acceptanceCriteria.then: matching tasks are displayed in real-time

acceptanceCriteria.given: I want to see specific types of tasks
acceptanceCriteria.when: I apply filters for status or category
I want to see all tasks again
acceptanceCriteria.then: I can easily clear all filters

edgeCases: Searching with special characters
Applying multiple filters simultaneously
Searching in empty task lists
Handling typos in search queries

features.name: Simple Dashboard and Analytics
features.description: Users see a clean dashboard showing task completion statistics, upcoming deadlines, and a summary of their productivity. Basic metrics include tasks completed today/this week, completion rate, and overdue task count. This feature provides users with insights into their productivity patterns and helps them understand their progress over time without overwhelming complexity.
features.userStory: As a user, I want to see a summary of my task progress and productivity so that I can understand my patterns and stay motivated

acceptanceCriteria.then: I see my completion rate, tasks completed today, and upcoming deadlines

acceptanceCriteria.given: I have been using the app for a week
acceptanceCriteria.then: I can see my productivity trends over the past week
I see a clear count of overdue items with quick access to view them

edgeCases: New users with no task history
Users with thousands of completed tasks
Handling data for users who create but never complete tasks

coreFeatures.mvpScope: The MVP will focus on core task management functionality including creating, editing, and completing tasks with basic organization through categories and due dates. Users will have a simple, clean interface for managing their daily tasks with essential filtering and search capabilities. Advanced features like team collaboration, integrations, and detailed analytics will be excluded from the initial release to maintain simplicity and speed to market.

roles.name: Individual User
roles.description: A single user managing their personal tasks and to-dos
permissions: Create, read, update, delete own tasks

keyFlows: User creates account and sets up first tasks
Daily workflow: check dashboard, add new tasks, complete existing tasks, review upcoming deadlines
Weekly review: analyze completed tasks, reorganize categories, plan upcoming week

requirements: Web application accessible via modern browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge)
Responsive design that works on desktop, tablet, and mobile browsers
Data persistence with reliable backup and recovery
Fast response times (<2 seconds for all user actions)
Offline capability for basic task viewing and creation
Simple user authentication and secure data storage

launchRequirements: All core task management features functional and tested
User authentication and data security implemented
Basic error handling and validation in place
Data backup and recovery systems operational
launchBlockers: Critical bugs in core task creation/completion flow
Performance issues causing >5 second load times
Complete failure on any major browser
Missing essential error handling causing app crashes
